description: This course focuses on international financial institutions and international banking activities. We will examine how current and historical events are reshaping the industry. We will focus on the basic analytics of managing a bank's exposure to liquidity, credit, market and country risk. In addition, we will consider how to evaluate and compare the risk exposures and performance of individual banks. Throughout the semester we will discuss public policy issues such as international debt crises and regulation.
name: INTERNATIONAL BANKING

values.comments:
Finance 220 focuses on international financial institutions and international banking activities and examines how current and historical events are reshaping the industry. The focus of the course is on the basic analytics of managing a bank's exposure to liquidity, credit, market and country risk. Additional topics covered include how to evaluate and compare the risk exposures and performance of individual banks. Throughout the semester, public policy issues such as international debt crises and regulation are discussed.

Students expressed a generally positive outlook on the course as a whole. Some expressed that course material was rather dry, while others found it comprehensive, interesting, and relevant to current events. One student called the course a “great overview of the financial crisis and day-to-day operations and risk management practices of banks.” 

According to one student, “Dr. Herring showed that he was an authority in the subject” and was “immensely knowledgeable in both depth and breadth regarding international banking.” Another student called Professor Herring a “true gentleman” and noted that office hours were helpful. Some students indicated that they would have preferred if lectures were a little clearer, better organized, and moved more slowly.

Students noted that the workload of the course, which included three projects and two exams, was balanced and the grading system was reasonable. Several students would recommend this course to anyone considering a career in finance.
